page.title: 16CRAFT CENTRE
page.content: The former stables to Staunton Harold Hall,round an open courtyard have been separated into 10 units,one rsidential & the rest leased by different craftsmen comprising the following trades. Numbers in brackets refer to the people employed:-violin maker(1), forged ironwork(2), woolcrafts(3), "Busy Sheep" woollen & skin goods(4), wood turner(1). A tearoom adjoining employs 1 to 4 people according to season. All of these people were obviously devoted to their craft, making a steady but not substantial living. They all benefited from the steady stream of customers to the adjacent nursery & from visitors to the Sue Ryder Home occupying the hall. The hall , nursery, craft centre & Cromwellian church are in a very attractive setting &popular with visitors throughout the year.
